_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PTERODACTYL PANEL - PTERODACTYL.IO
name: Vanilla Bedrock
author: parker@parkervcp.com
description: Bedrock Edition (also known as the Bedrock Version, Bedrock Codebase, Bedrock Engine or just Bedrock) refers to the multi-platform family of editions of Minecraft developed by Mojang AB, Microsoft Studios, 4J Studios, and SkyBox Labs. Prior to this term, as the engine originated with Pocket Edition, this entire product family was referred to as "Pocket Edition", "MCPE", or "Pocket/Windows 10 Edition".

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash

apt update
apt install -y zip unzip wget curl

if [ ! -d /mnt/server/ ]; then
    mkdir /mnt/server/
fi

cd /mnt/server

# Minecraft CDN Akamai blocks script user-agents
RANDVERSION=$(echo $((1 + $RANDOM % 4000)))

if [ -z "${BEDROCK_VERSION}" ] || [ "${BEDROCK_VERSION}" == "latest" ]; then
    echo -e "\n Downloading latest Bedrock server"
    curl -L -A "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/90.0.$RANDVERSION.212 Safari/537.36" -H "Accept-Language: en" -H "Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate" -o versions.html.gz https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/download/server/bedrock
    DOWNLOAD_URL=$(zgrep -o 'https://minecraft.azureedge.net/bin-linux/[^"]*' versions.html.gz)
else 
    echo -e "\n Downloading ${BEDROCK_VERSION} Bedrock server"
    DOWNLOAD_URL=https://minecraft.azureedge.net/bin-linux/bedrock-server-$BEDROCK_VERSION.zip
fi

DOWNLOAD_FILE=$(echo ${DOWNLOAD_URL} | cut -d"/" -f5) # Retrieve archive name

echo -e "backing up config files"
rm *.bak versions.html.gz
cp server.properties server.properties.bak
cp permissions.json permissions.json.bak
cp whitelist.json whitelist.json.bak

echo -e "Downloading files from: $DOWNLOAD_URL"

curl -L -A "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/90.0.$RANDVERSION.212 Safari/537.36" -H "Accept-Language: en" -o $DOWNLOAD_FILE $DOWNLOAD_URL

echo -e "Unpacking server files"
unzip -o $DOWNLOAD_FILE

echo -e "Cleaning up after installing"
rm $DOWNLOAD_FILE

echo -e "restoring backup config files - on first install there will be file not found errors which you can ignore."
cp -rf server.properties.bak server.properties
cp -rf permissions.json.bak permissions.json
cp -rf whitelist.json.bak whitelist.json

chmod +x bedrock_server

echo -e "Install Completed"

variables.name: Bedrock Version
variables.description:
The version of bedrock. (Ex. 1.7.0.13)

Default version is latest.

variables.name: ld lib path
variables.description: Dumb reasons to need this

variables.name: Allow List
variables.description: If true then all connected players must be listed in the separate allowlist.json file.

variables.name: Chat Restriction
variables.description:
This represents the level of restriction applied to the chat for each player that joins the server.
"None" is the default and represents regular free chat. 
"Dropped" means the chat messages are dropped and never sent to any client. Players receive a message to let them know the feature is disabled. 
 "Disabled" means that unless the player is an operator, the chat UI does not even appear. No information is displayed to the player.

variables.name: Clacks Endpoint
variables.description: some sort of url / domain port combo

variables.name: Client Side Chunk Generation Enabled
variables.description: If true, the server will inform clients that they have the ability to generate visual level chunks outside of player interaction distances.

variables.name: Compression Algorithm
variables.description: Determines the compression algorithm to use for networking

variables.name: Compression Threshold
variables.description: Determines the smallest size of raw network payload to compress. 0-65535

variables.name: Content Log File Enabled
variables.description: Enables logging content errors to a file

variables.name: Correct Player Movement
variables.description: If true, the client position will get corrected to the server position if the movement score exceeds the threshold.

variables.name: Default Player Permission Level
variables.description: Permission level for new players joining for the first time.

variables.name: Difficulty
variables.description: Sets the difficulty of the world.

variables.name: Disable Player Interaction
variables.description: If true, the server will inform clients that they should ignore other players when interacting with the world. This is not server authoritative.

variables.name: Emit Server Telemetry
variables.description: If true, the server will emit telemetry data to the Mojang telemetry servers. "Enabling this telemetry helps us improve the game.", when you start the server.

variables.name: Enable Item Stack Net Manager Deprecated
Enable Lan Visibility
variables.description: Listen and respond to clients that are looking for servers on the LAN. This will cause the server to bind to the default ports (19132, 19133) even when `server-port` and `server-portv6` have non-default values. Consider turning this off if LAN discovery is not desirable, or when running multiple servers on the same host may lead to port conflicts.

variables.name: Force Gamemode
variables.description:
force-gamemode=false (or force-gamemode  is not defined in the server.properties) prevents the server from sending to the client gamemode values other than the gamemode value saved by the server during world creation even if those values are set in server.properties after world creation.
force-gamemode=true forces the server to send to the client gamemode values other than the gamemode value saved by the server during world creation if those values are set in server.properties after world creation.

variables.name: Gamemode
variables.description: Sets the game mode for new players.

variables.name: Level Name
variables.description:
Any string without semicolon symbol or symbols illegal for file name: /
	 `?*\<>|":

variables.name: Level Seed
variables.description: Use to randomize the world seed. Any string

variables.name: Max Players
variables.description: The maximum number of players that can play on the server. Any positive integer

variables.name: Max Threads
variables.description: Maximum number of threads the server will try to use. If set to 0 or removed then it will use as many as possible. Any positive integer.

variables.name: Online Mode
variables.description: If true then all connected players must be authenticated to Xbox Live. Clients connecting to remote (non-LAN) servers will always require Xbox Live authentication regardless of this setting. If the server accepts connections from the Internet, then it's highly recommended to enable online-mode.

variables.name: Player Idle Timeout
variables.description: After a player has idled for this many minutes they will be kicked. If set to 0 then players can idle indefinitely. Any non-negative integer.

variables.name: Player Movement Action Direction Threshold
variables.description:
Type: Float. 
The amount that the player's attack direction and look direction can differ. Allowed values: Any value in the range of [0, 1] where 1 means that the direction of the players view and the direction the player is attacking must match exactly and a value of 0 means that the two directions can differ by up to and including 90 degrees.

variables.name: Player Movement Distance Threshold
variables.description:
Type: Float. 
The difference between server and client positions that needs to be exceeded before abnormal behavior is detected. Disabled by server-authoritative-movement.

variables.name: Player Movement Duration Threshold In Ms
variables.description: The duration of time the server and client positions can be out of sync (as defined by player-movement-distance-threshold) before the abnormal movement score is incremented. This value is defined in milliseconds. Disabled by server-authoritative-movement.

variables.name: Player Movement Score Threshold
variables.description:
Type: Float. 
The number of incongruent time intervals needed before abnormal behavior is reported. Disabled by server-authoritative-movement.

variables.name: Player Rewind Min Correction Delay Ticks
Player Rewind Position Acceptance
variables.description: Type: Float.

variables.name: Player Rewind Position Persuasion
variables.description: Type: Float.

variables.name: Player Rewind Position Threshold
variables.description: Type: Float.

variables.name: Player Rewind Velocity Threshold
variables.description: Type: Float.

variables.name: Player Tick Throttled Input Batch Size
Player Tick Throttled Max Tick Credits
Remote Server Communication Endpoint
variables.description: some sort of url / domain port combo

variables.name: Script Watchdog Memory Limit
variables.description: must be higher than 2000

variables.name: Script Watchdog Memory Warning
variables.description: must be higher than 2000

variables.name: Server Authoritative Block Breaking
variables.description: If true, the server will compute block mining operations in sync with the client so it can verify that the client should be able to break blocks when it thinks it can.

variables.name: Server Authoritative Block Breaking Pick Range Scalar
variables.description: Type: Float.

variables.name: Server Authoritative Movement
variables.description: Enables server authoritative movement. If "server-auth", the server will replay local user input on the server and send down corrections when the client's position doesn't match the server's. If server-auth-with-rewind" is enabled and the server sends a correction, the clients will be instructed to rewind time back to the correction time, apply the correction, then replay all the player's inputs since then. This results in smoother and more frequent corrections. Corrections will only happen if correct-player-movement is set to true.

variables.name: Server Name
variables.description:
Used as the server name
Any string without semicolon symbol.

variables.name: Texturepack Required
variables.description: Force clients to use texture packs in the current world

variables.name: Tick Distance
variables.description: The world will be ticked this many chunks away from any player. Integers in the range [4, 12] inclusive

variables.name: View Distance
variables.description: The maximum allowed view distance in number of chunks. Positive integer equal to 5 or greater.

variables.name: Wserver Retry Time
variables.description: Type: Float.
